title: Fragment of a public inscription
support: Fragment of a fine white limestone, broken on all sides, seemingly including the rear also (so not preserving original thickness); presumably part of a plaque or stele.

layout.p: Letters preserved from four lines of text, damaged on all sides.

handNote.lettering: Arena notes that the quadrangular module of the individual letters is regular, letters with neat terminal serifs, elegantly cut, comparable in size and form to the other surviving fragments of the cadastral inscription, ISic001174.

date._: Later 2nd century BCE or early C1 BCE

provenanceFound._: Casual find on 13 March 2007 in the area SE of the Church of S. Maria, in the area of Carettoni's trench XLIX, immediately to the west of the 'decumanus'.

provenanceObserved._: In the archaeological stores of the Soprintendenza di Messina

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

repository._: Soprintendenza Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Messina

museum.name: Soprintendenza Beni Culturali e Ambientali di Messina
museum.description: Offices and stores of the provincial archaeological authority
